reasoning: This is a foundational layer implementation with 25+ files (10 enums, 5 utilities, 9 entities, tests) in a single iOS service. Uses standard Swift/Core Data patterns with no external integrations. Clear specifications provided in ERD, Feature Spec, and Algorithm docs eliminate need for research phase.

scope.notes: 10 enum files, 5 utility/extension files, 9 domain entity files, Core Data extensions, 3+ test files. All contained within single iOS app service.

integrations.notes: Core Data is built-in Apple framework, not external. No third-party libraries required.

infrastructure.notes: Core Data model (.xcdatamodeld) already exists in project. Entity implementations will use existing Core Data stack.

knowledge.notes: Standard Swift/Core Data patterns. PersistenceController already implemented. ERD and specs provide complete implementation guidance.

concerns: 02:00 sleep boundary logic requires careful implementation
Entity relationships must match ERD exactly
Validation rules must match Feature Spec
risk.notes: Foundational layer with unit tests included. Critical business logic (DateUtils sleep boundary) will be test-covered.

validation_recommendations.reasoning: Foundational data model layer with no external APIs, no security-sensitive code, and unit tests explicitly included in task scope. Single service, standard Swift patterns.
